bug.author: angnicolas
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Type here a clear and concise description of the bug. Aim for 2-3 sentences. Dataframe Hello Demo thrown error <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Go to streamlit hello Click on DataFrame demo
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
It should show me the demo <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Explain the buggy behavior you experience when you go through the steps above. If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
That is, did this use to work the way you expected in the past? yes / no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: (get it with $ streamlit version) 0.47.4
Python version: (get it with $ python --version) 3.7
Conda / Pip
OS version:10.14.6
Browser version: Chrome Version 77.0.3865.90 (Official Build) (64-bit)
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
If needed, add any other context about the problem here.

comments.comment:
Hi there! This looks like a dupe of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/242>#242</denchmark-link> . The fix is coming soon with PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/254>#254</denchmark-link>
(Closing this as a duplicate. Please reopen if you think this is not right)
